CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 22, 1945, reads: "Last Rites - Last rites were held for Norman Chestang, 11-year-old boy who hanged himself with a belt at his home last week, after attempting to reenact a cowboy thriller story he had seen in movies. The West Funeral Home handled burial arrangements. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Boys and young men carrying the light colored casket of Norman Chestang out of West Funeral Home into falling snow, with women and girls holding floral arrangements standing on side
